Headline: Project Serotonin | ISB
Comment:
Love this! This is the essence of what we are and here is what has happened in the process!

Focus is on preventing disease by optimising nutrition and lifestyle - and the body has treated its own ailments, as it is given the right foundation

We engage - gamefied the product so that users are driven to use the platform and thereby have benefitted

Prove - it has taken us 8 years - the body not a hardware product where testing cycles are just another bug fix

Empower - life happens, we give you the tools that is best for you

Simplify - Science is heavy, we translate it to actionables. 20% of the interventions can bring about 80% improvements. We pick the interventions that give the best results (based on peer reviewed science and out own data)

Check us out at sr.tn or feel free to reach out to me directly if you want to join or know more about the program!

Headline: Founder | Operator (Diversified) | I build ventures brick by brick and offer the mortar to others | At my best when dealing with Cross-Functional matters.
Comment:
Dilip Kumar 

The current healthcare market in India has long been reactive, centered around treatment rather than prevention, a strategy that has become outdated.

Giants like Apollo and Fortis have traditionally focused on curative care, but the future demands a strategic pivot. Startups like Curefit - house of cult and HealthifyMe App  are ahead of the curve, building their entire model around prevention, user engagement, and holistic wellness, which is proving to be more sustainable in the long run.

The shift to "prove, not promise" is key to long-term success. Practo‚Äôs user-review strategy exemplifies how validation and trust can become a competitive advantage.

As the healthcare landscape evolves, companies that adopt preventive care, empower users with knowledge, and offer simplified, user-friendly experiences will truly stand out.

Strategically, this isn't just a trend, it's a survival strategy for the future of healthcare.

Worth thinking about!

Headline: Conservative Dentist & Endodontist | Building Tec2Tee | Making Dental Technologies Exciting | Stanford Seed 07 |
Comment:
Love this, Dilip Kumar!

1. Prevent, don't treat‚Äì Tech like wearables and AI make prevention easier and actionable.

2. Engage, don't shout‚Äì Personalize care through real conversations, not sales talk.

3. Empower, don't instruct‚Äì Simple, clear education builds trust and confidence.

4. Simplify, don't complicate‚Äì Keep tech intuitive so patients and providers focus on health, not complexity.

5. Prove, don't promise ‚Äì Show real-world results. Data and trials speak louder than marketing.

This aligns perfectly with the direction healthcare needs to take‚Äîthanks for sharing!

Headline: Helping families afford healthcare | 100+ families helped | Health & Term Insurance | Financial Literacy
Comment:
Healthcare entrepreneurs and builders, here are my 15 words for you:

Balance, don‚Äôt oversimplify 
Inform, don‚Äôt preach 
Adapt, don‚Äôt rigidify 
Validate, don‚Äôt exaggerate 
Engage, don‚Äôt ignore

Will elaborate:

Balance, don‚Äôt oversimplify ‚Äì Find the right mix of prevention and treatment, complexity and simplicity. 
Inform, don‚Äôt preach ‚Äì Provide knowledge and structure, not just one or the other. 
Adapt, don‚Äôt rigidify ‚Äì Be flexible and responsive to the ever-changing landscape of healthcare. 
Validate, don‚Äôt exaggerate ‚Äì Back up your claims with evidence, but don't forget the importance of marketing. 
Engage, don‚Äôt ignore ‚Äì Build meaningful conversations, but also convert that engagement into action. Dilip Kumar

Headline: Co-Founder
Comment:
Preventive healthcare, in its current form, will always fail. No stakeholder in the ecosystem is incentivised to prevent. This includes patients. The TG for preventive healthcare is very very small.  

The problem with Wellness/Preventive healthcare is that it sucks out all joy from life ! Wake up at 4 am, workout , eat salads, dont drink, dont smoke, sleep early etc etc. 

Frankly, what's the point of an endless endeavour to prolong a joyless life :-). 

What will work is an Early Detection platform that allows humans to have some bad habits and lets them know when they need to tone down. Let humans be humans !
